title: KARNet: Kalman Filter Augmented Recurrent Neural Network for Learning World Models in Autonomous Driving Tasks. (arXiv:2305.14644v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Autonomous driving has received a great deal of attention in the automotive industry and is often seen as the future of transportation. The development of autonomous driving technology has been greatly accelerated by the growth of end-to-end machine learning techniques that have been successfully used for perception, planning, and control tasks. An important aspect of autonomous driving planning is knowing how the environment evolves in the immediate future and taking appropriate actions. An autonomous driving system should effectively use the information collected from the various sensors to form an abstract representation of the world to maintain situational awareness. For this purpose, deep learning models can be used to learn compact latent representations from a stream of incoming data. However, most deep learning models are trained end-to-end and do not incorporate any prior knowledge (e.g., from physics) of the vehicle in the architecture. In this direction, many works have expl

Title: KARNet: Kalman Filter Augmented Recurrent Neural Network for Learning World Models in Autonomous Driving Tasks. (arXiv:2305.14644v1 [cs.LG])
Abstract: Autonomous driving has received a great deal of attention in the automotive industry and is often seen as the future of transportation. The development of autonomous driving technology has been greatly accelerated by the growth of end-to-end machine learning techniques that have been successfully used for perception, planning, and control tasks. An important aspect of autonomous driving planning is knowing how the environment evolves in the immediate future and taking appropriate actions. An autonomous driving system should effectively use the information collected from the various sensors to form an abstract representation of the world to maintain situational awareness. For this purpose, deep learning models can be used to learn compact latent representations from a stream of incoming data. However, most deep learning models are trained end-to-end and do not incorporate any prior knowledge (e.g., from physics) of the vehicle in the architecture. In this direction, many works have expl
translated_title: KARNet: 卡尔曼滤波增强的循环神经网络用于自动驾驶任务中的世界模型学习。
translated_abstract: 自动驾驶在汽车工业中受到广泛关注，通常被视为交通运输业的未来发展方向。基于端到端机器学习技术的快速发展，自动驾驶技术的发展已经得到很大加速，并被成功应用于感知、规划和控制任务中。自动驾驶规划的一个重要方面是了解环境在不久的将来会如何演变并采取适当的行动。为了保持情境感知，自动驾驶系统应有效地利用从各种传感器收集的信息来形成世界的抽象表示。为此，可以使用深度学习模型从传入数据流中学习紧凑的潜在表示。然而，大多数深度学习模型都是端到端训练的，并不在体系结构中融合任何先前知识（例如物理知识）。在这方面，许多工作探索将领域特定知识集成到深度学习模型中以获得更好的准确性和鲁棒性。本文提出了Kalman滤波增强的循环神经网络（KARNet），将Kalman滤波器，一种广泛用于控制系统中的方法，集成到循环神经网络中，用于学习自动驾驶任务的世界模型。KARNet可以有效地利用行驶工具的先前知识来提高预测环境未来状态的准确性和效率。在基准自动驾驶数据集上进行的实验结果表明，KARNet优于现有的最先进方法，并在预测精度和计算效率之间取得了更好的平衡。
tldr: 本文提出了一种名为KARNet的模型，将Kalman滤波器集成到循环神经网络中，用于学习自动驾驶任务的世界模型。该模型可以有效地利用先前的领域知识来提高预测的准确性和效率。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes KARNet, a model that integrates the Kalman filter into a recurrent neural network to learn a world model for autonomous driving tasks. It effectively utilizes prior knowledge to improve prediction accuracy and efficiency.
